title: Best Place
review: i just love this place at char dukan....Well maintained church with ncie view and locality...a must for every traveller...

title: Holy place
review: This is one of the attraction in Mall road. Church is in upper mall road. Church is big and beautiful.

title: Nice Church
review: St. Paul's Church is located in Landour. It is close to Char Dukan. It is a nice building and is worth visiting once.

title: Mussoorie’s St. Paul’s Church, Landour
review: Part of the Britishers history in India, St. Paul’s Church with its large yellow structure was consecrated as far back as in 1840. Surely worth a visited, it is situated in Landour’s ‘Char Dukan’ area, (about two kilometres before Lal Tibba, the highest point in Mussoorie)

title: A piece of Heritage in Landour
review: Unfortunately when we visited this place, the church was closed. But this large structure with its pale yellow color blended perfectly with the ambience of Char Dukan.

title: secluded
review: the church is a beautiful one located near char dukan inlandour...yellow colored church with trees surrounding it...it was built during the British era

title: Heritage India
review: The day we visited it was a wedding had just taken place in the church as such it was well decorated. A beautiful and well maintained church.

title: Good for a quick Photo Pit stop
review: Situated next to Char Dukaan, you will anyway come across it . There is nothing special about this church . Just a a normal church . Since its next to Char Dukaan , from where we started our entire tour of Landour, we clicked a few pictures on the steps.

title: Nice quiet place
review: It remains closed most of the times. we tried to get timing but nothing was mentioned on it. Please check at char dukan

title: shining place
review: I walked from down town, one hour, and came to this church. Meeting the monkeys in front of. beautiful architecture, clean, shining....

title: A Sanctuary Of Peace
review: No matter who you are, or what you do; there's something about the mountains that make us all happy and excited. Maybe it is the peace, the quietness, the stillness, that entices us, city dwellers, into exploring the vastness of nature in the lap of mountains.

title: Awesome Location and Peaceful Clean Church
review: Its on the way to Lal Tibba

title: Reflection!
review: A church always brings a sense of calm and this one is no different. Set in the heart of char dukan, it’s a lovely place to go and reflect. For ₹10 you can light a tea light for an intention :)

title: Gives an insight into British History
review: St. Paul's Church is located on Lal Tibba, Landour Cantt area and is a reminiscent of British rule in Mussoorie.

title: Nice one
review: At char dukan, lovely place- great architecture- nice walk around this region too, worth visiting if you have a long day

title: Must visit when at Landour
review: This church I believe still offers service as we could hear the bells when staying at Landour. It's at Char Dukan. I went there with my 7 year old, it was his first time visiting a Church, he found the place were calming and liked it a lot ! It's a lovely place and amazingly restored to its former glory (I would like to believe).

title: A slice of history
review: A must visit. Go through all the plaques, and you will be enlightened about this cute town. Its is as if time has stood still.

title: nice church in landour
review: very peaceful place in landour. away from crowed mussoorie. view from church was great. if you want peace visit here and spend 2 hours. you will like

title: great church
review: it is good church in landour. not much crowed and very peaceful with great views. you can take many photos with natural beauty.. much visit place

title: A beautiful monument
review: A nice small church , right in front of Chardukan , bearing the testimony of British soldiers, for whom it was constructed. You can sit and pray quietly to get to your inner soul. A good place to be in Landour.

title: Reminiscent of an era.
review: Out of few distinct landmarks Landour has; St. Paul's church stands first when you enter Landour. A yellow color church building blue sky and green mountain trees in backdrop paints a perfect picture of an English village. It boasts of witnessing some two hundred years of history. Stained glass windows wooden benches are all reminiscent of British era. Right at the corner of char dukan area this is something cannot be missed. Everything is very well kept and maintained. Church care taker will let you know about the details. Photography is prohibited inside building. Parking is limited as usual in Landour. One visit inside the building is must.

title: Old charming building
review: Built in 1840 in british era. This beautiful church is an iconic building of landour. One can visit it along with lal tibba or char dukan. Visit inside and you will get sink in the old era of mussoorie.

title: Interesting Place
review: The place is a landmark and pride of Landour. The Church is open only on Sundays and has a great cultural and historical history.

title: A wonderful and peaceful Church.
review: I loved this church because it is so cozy and peaceful. It is located right in the heart of mussoorie and is a lovely place to visit.
